adjective.description: Easily understood or done; presenting no difficulty.
examples: camcorders are now so simple to operate

adjective.description: Plain, basic, or uncomplicated in form, nature, or design; without much decoration or ornamentation.
examples: the house is furnished in a simple country style

adjective.description: Composed of a single element; not compound.
Of low or abnormally low intelligence.

noun.description: A medicinal herb, or a medicine made from one.

exclamation.description: Used to convey that something is very straightforward.
examples: I don't overanalyze. I listen, I like, I buy. Simple!

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin simplus. The noun sense (mid 16th century) originally referred to a medicine made from one constituent, especially from one plant.
